name: apatosaurus
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a very large dinosaur that ate plants and had four legs, a very long neck and tail, and a small head: All the dinosaurs we thought of as Brontosauruses were really Apatosauruses. Apatosaurus, once known as Brontosaurus, was a huge plant-eating dinosaur about the size and weight of a large diesel locomotive. Compare
brontosaurus
Kostyantyn Ivanyshen/Stocktrek Images/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesDiplodocus reached a length of 28 m but weighed only 10 tonnes, whereas Apatosaurus was shorter at 25 m, but weighed 30 tonnes.Marsh put the wrong skull on a skeleton of Apatosaurus and declared it a new genus, Brontosaurus. The museum houses a 60-foot-long metallic Apatosaurus skeleton.
